og.description: Actuaries at the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services have released their estimates of national health spending for 2014 through 2024.Out-of-pocket spending as a share of personal health care (net of retail sales) dropped from 18 percent in 2007 to 16 percent in 2014, and will continue down to 14 percent in 2024. The administrative burden of over insurance by government and private insurers also increases. This is the added cost due to having claims processed by an administrative bureaucracy that stands between the patient and the provider. For private insurance alone, the net cost of health insurance rose from 18 percent of insurers’ payments to providers in 2007 to 20 percent in 2014, and will rise to 22 percent in 2024.
og.title: The Cost Of Over Insurance: National Health Expenditures Rising Again
